result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Ocana was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Park], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

IT IS ORDERED that the Wis. Stat. Rule 809.30 appeal rights are reinstated.  The time for filing a notice of intent to pursue post conviction releif is extended to January 11, 2017.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time to act under either Wis. Stat. Rule 809.30(2)(e) or (f) commences as of the date of this order.

Dated 1/19/17 - IT IS ORDERED that no later than February 10, 2017, the State shall advise whether it objects to Daniel Ocana's motion to reinstate his appeal rights.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that all documents filed in this court must indicate that they have been served on the Attorney General.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney F Parise.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 14 years WSP; 9 years initial confinement w/credit for 310 days served; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel J. Ocana appeared with Attorney Frank J. Parise.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over.  Atty Parise objects to case being originally tabbed to Br 3 because of post-conviction motions in another case being tabbed to Br 6.  Substitution of Br 3 filed by DE;  tab pulled for Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond reduction motion has been filed; arguments heard; Court denies motion. Bond continued.
